snippet: Charges of favoritism have emerged against Senator Robert Menendez, a Democrat of New Jersey, since a team of Republicans put him in its cross hairs.
abstract: Charges of favoritism that have emerged against Democratic Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey illustrate the often-hidden role that partisan players have in helping push the major news media to dig into ethical allegations lodged against sitting members of Congress; combination of allegations, of misuse of public office and of sexual misconduct, helped propel the story into the headlines and onto television.

byline.contributor: Frances Robles contributed reporting from the Dominican Republic.

lead_paragraph: Charges of favoritism have emerged against Senator Robert Menendez, a Democrat of New Jersey, since a team of Republicans put him in its cross hairs.

headline.seo: Partisan Push Led to Troubling Revelations About Senator Menendez
headline.main: Inquiry on Democratic Senator Started With a Partisan Push
headline.print_headline: Inquiry on Menendez’s Influence Was Powered by Partisan Players
